item.title: The Scenic Route: A Self-Driving Adventure on the 318 Sichuan|Tibet Line
item.description: China’s Sichuan-Tibet Highway 318 is a popular and classic self-driving route, favored by many adventurers. It typically refers to the section of National Highway 318 from Chengdu to Lhasa, covering about 2,000 kilometers. The southern Sichuan-Tibet line, located along the 30th parallel north, begins at Ya’an and diverges from National Highway 108. As it winds westward, it crosses Erlang Mountain and is renowned as “China’s Scenic Avenue.” For a self-driving trip to Lhasa, it is recommended to start from Chengdu and pass through Luding—Kangding—Xinduqiao—Yajiang—Litang—Batang—Zuogong—Basu—Ranwu—Bomi—Motuo—Nyingchi, and finally reach Lhasa, the capital of Tibet.
